query: What is software architecture?

query: What is the requirement for the Duke AI Foundations for Product Innovation Graduate Certificate program?
answer: Participants should have an undergraduate degree in science or engineering (or equivalent technical work experience), a minimum of one semester of programming (any language), and two semesters of calculus. Participants are expected to be working full-time while completing the Certificate program.

query: What topics are covered in the final module of AIPI 503?
answer: The final module will focus on a review of probability and statistics with an emphasis on simulation of chance experiments. Topics for this last module will include discrete distributions, continuous density functions, combinatorics, conditional probabilities and a final review of important densities and functions.
